newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Oct 9.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Oct 9.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Wednesday:
** Trial of 64 people charged for offences during the July 27 Jakarta riots opens in Jakarta central court.

** Indonesia was likely to end up in trade war with major trading partners Japan, the United States and the European Union if Indonesia insisted on carrying out its national car policy, a noted economist said.
** The Dow Jones industrial average ended 13.04 points lower at 5,966.77 on Tuesday after an early rally stalled at 6,010.37 as investors took profits amid worries about corporate earnings.

** The Jakarta index fell 11.53 points, or 1.97 percent, to close at 574.78 points after touching an intra-day low of 573.12 points in mid-afternoon trade on Tuesday on continued foreign selling of heavyweight stocks led by clove cigarette maker Sampoerna.
** On Wednesday, the Indonesian rupiah was at 2,320.25/20.60 in early trading against an opening of 2,320.50/21.50.

** Polyester and resin producer PT Indorama Synthetics on announcement that its shareholders had approved a four-for-five bonus issue, and a split in the nominal value of each share to 500 rupiah from 1,000 rupiah.
** Sampoerna on a recent $400-million loan which the cigarette giant said was for "corporate development", but analysts said the purpose was considered vague as it lacked details.
** Battery producer Nipress on market talk of a possible stock split.
** Property firms Dharmala Intiland and Putra Surya Perkasa on reports of a possible alliance.
